system.description: The enchanter of the woods, these wandering spell casters resemble Rangers in their wanderlust. More comfortable with animals than people, Nature Mages are always heading to the woods and keeping to themselves. Ever in defense of the land, Nature Mages are like environmentalists. Nature Mages are in tune with the world at all times. If you are playing a Nature Mage be reclusive, avoiding people if you can, happy in nature and eager to leave any civilization.

overview.base: You may rotate between nature rotator spells during a short rest instead of a long rest.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Nature Rotators. (This does not make you fluent in the spells themselves.)

overview.base: When you attack with Empathic Ray or Treeform Ball, you may target an additional creature or the same creature twice. Any costs you pay must be paid twice and be the same for both attacks These incur attack penalties as though they were two separate attacks.
overview.fluent: You may instead choose up to 1 + F additional or repeated targets.

overview.base: Add Advanced Hack Healing and Transmute to your list of possible rotator spells.

In addition to the custom rotator spells you create, you can learn spells created by others. When you come across a fully created spell using only words you are fluent in, can make a DC 12 + OP INT feat save to attempt to learn it. If you succeed, you can add it to your rotator spell list. If you fail, you are incapable of attempting to learn that spell again. The GM may modify the DC based on the spell's complexity, your knowledge of the spell, any special training you receive, if the spell's creator is there to assist you, or for any other factors they see fit. You may also attempt to learn words that you come across as long as they are of elements you are fluent in. The GM may adjust the DC for these as they see fit as well, but the default is DC 15 + OP INT feat save.
overview.proficient: You are fluent in Elder Sorcery Creation, Celestial Elder Sorcery Words, and Nature Elder Sorcery Words.

results.save: You learn the spell or word.
results.fail: You are incapable of attempting to learn that spell or word again.

overview.base: You gain Limited Spell Strike.

Once per short rest, you may cast a ritual nature spell in half the time it would normally take. Additionally, once per long rest, you may cast a nature spell as though you were adept at it.

You also gain the Branching and Territorial casting styles.
overview.proficient: You may now use the benefits from Nature Disciplines P times per long rest.
overview.fluent: You may now use the benefits from Nature Disciplines F times per short rest.

overview.base: Target takes the "on hit" effect of a conjured missile spell that you are proficient in. If the triggering hit was a critical hit, then the target takes the "on critical hit" effect instead.

system.trigger: You have just landed a hit with a weapon or bite attack on another creature and the effect has successfully applied.
system.limitation: Only usable with Empathic Ray and Treeform Ball.

overview.base: You may select an additional target within 30 feet of the triggering spell's original target. Your spell targets them as well. Any attack rolls, feat saves, or other necessary rolls must be made for the new target as well.

system.trigger: A spell you cast affects at least one target other than yourself.

overview.base: Whenever you heal, you may heal a hack as well.
You cast a single action spell at the triggering creature.

system.trigger: Another creature moves within 5 feet of you.

overview.base:
The triggering ability is "transformed" into a hack instead of its normal effect. The type of the hack is determined by the target of the triggering ability.
Creature target abilities
Transformed into a body hack.
Vitals target abilities
Transformed into a vitals hack of your choice.
Arm target abilities
Transformed into an arm hack.
Leg target abilities
Transformed into a leg hack.
Limb target abilities
If no limb is specified in either the target or the effect, it is transformed into a limb hack of your choice.

If the triggering ability was UB, but you otherwise would have been able to Block it, you may treat it as though it targeted your arm.

system.trigger: You would take a standard ability.
